messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1571
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/6/01 1:59:37 PM Mountain Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/6/01 1:59:37 PM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< My whole life, I have hated Pecan Pie. Couldn't stand the stuff. But, I
believe that it is good to retry foods periodically to remember WHY you
don't like them. So today, I tried Pecan Pie again. Great Stuff! I
love it now. Over the years, my tastes have changed a lot. I now eat
loads of things I didn't like when I was younger. >>


Your taste buds change over life. Many foods children typically don't like
are well liked later in life. Also has to do w/ our inate ability to weed
through toxic foods. Little bodies can't handle what adults can.

NICKI~
